meanings.definition: To exude drops of liquid, especially water, through pores or small openings.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the leaves guttated water droplets in the morning sun.
meanings.sent2: The plant guttated water as a way to release excess moisture.
meanings.sent3: The tree guttated so much water, it looked like it was crying tears of joy.
meanings.sent4: The guttated drops on the petals sparkled like diamonds in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The guttated liquid trickled down the stem, nourishing the plant.

meanings.definition: Covered with small drops of liquid, especially water.
meanings.sent1: The guttated leaves glistened in the morning dew.
meanings.sent2: The guttated surface of the fruit indicated its freshness.
meanings.sent3: The guttated petals looked like they were wearing tiny crystal crowns.
meanings.sent4: The guttated windows blurred the view of the garden outside.
meanings.sent5: The guttated grass felt cool and refreshing underfoot.
